intro: Condalia henriquezii, commonly known as the Mexican trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, elliptical seeds.
